message_content:
The study measures individuals’ knowledge and attitudes about air quality control policies (what people know and believe), their behavioral intentions (willingness to act), and their attitudes toward specific air quality policies. Therefore, it covers:

- Perceptions: assessing knowledge and attitudes about air quality and policies  
- Behaviors: measuring stated intentions to take actions for air quality improvement  
- Policy: evaluating attitudes toward air quality control policies  

output_json

{
  "categories": ["Perceptions", "Behaviors", "Policy"]
}

This paper examines how residents perceive health risks from traffic-related air pollution (lay beliefs, perceived effects on self/family) using interview and survey data. It focuses on what people think and know about the health impacts of pollution. Therefore, it falls under:

- Perceptions: it explores people’s perceptions and beliefs about air pollution risks.  
- Health: it specifically addresses perceived health impacts and health-related beliefs.

{
    "categories": ["Perceptions", "Health"]
}
